2)Pharmaceutical Chemistry is the study of the molecular and mechanistic aspects of pharmaceuticals. The discipline emphasizes the chemistry of drug design and development, drug action, drug transport, drug delivery, and targeting. 

3)The development of new pharmaceuticals is critically dependent on a molecular-level understanding of biological processes and mechanisms of drug action. Progress in the field now depends on the design and synthesis of new molecules using tools such as structure-activity relationships, combinatorial chemistry, and computer-aided drug design.

4)Pharmaceutical Chemistry will emphasize the molecular basis underlying the creation of new drugs and health applications of bioactive compounds.

results.admissionProcedure: Based on 12th Marks
results.name: B.Sc Physics with Computer Application
results.generalDetails:
1) B.Sc. in Physics and Computer Applications is a three year graduate course designed to teach both physics subjects and computer applications. The physics subjects help the students to understand the different aspects of Physics including phenomenology, theories and techniques, concepts and general principles. 

2)The students can develop the ability to read, understand and interpret physical information in verbal, mathematical and graphical and can also understand the methodology related to Physics.

3) Computer Applications are the software, programs or set of programs designed and developed and run on computer or related devices for a specific applications or purposes. Computer application subjects are formatted to teach the use, develop, design and maintaining of computer application software, including integration of applications. Also, students can developed their experimental and data analysis skills through a wide range of experiments and practicals at laboratories.

4)The subjects in Physics and Computer Application include Methodology in Physics, Mechanics & Properties of Matter,Electricity & Electrodynamics, Classical & Quantum Mechanics, Physical Optics & Photonics, Thermal & Statistical Physics, Digital Electronics, Computational Physics,Nuclear & Particle Physics,Condensed Matter Physics Practical, 
Computer Fundamentals, Operating System & Computer Networks, Word & Data,Processing Packages,Programming Languages, Concepts of Object Oriented Programming, C++ Programming, Visual Basic Programming, Computer Web Applications & Graphics.

results.name: B.Tech Mechanical Engineering (Sandwich)
results.generalDetails:
1)Mechanical engineering is a branch of engineering that involves the study of maintenance, design, and development of mechanical systems.

2)Mechanical Engineers play a vital role in various industries such as energy conversion, biotechnology, computers, electronics, aerospace, and countless others.

3)Mechanical Engineering involves the study of core subjects like Strength of Materials, Thermodynamics, Manufacturing processes, Fluid Mechanics, Machine Design, Heat and Mass Transfer, and the Theory of Machines.

4)A 'sandwich course' is a program where students will have at least one session (ranging from 9-12 months) to work in a particular industry (if you have opted for a vocational study program or study abroad placements for any other course) in between the academic sessions.

1)Petroleum engineering is a field of engineering concerned with the activities related to the production of hydrocarbons, which can be either crude oil or natural gas. Exploration and production are deemed to fall within the upstream sector(exploration, drilling, and extraction) of the oil and gas industry.

2)Petroleum engineering, is the branch of engineering that focuses on processes that allow the development and exploitation of crude oil and natural gas fields as well as the technical analysis, computer modeling, and forecasting of their future production performance.


3)Some of the major subjects taught in a petroleum engineering course are physics, chemistry, mathematics, geology, thermodynamics, computation, applied mechanics, and structural engineering.

results.name: Diploma in Podiatry
results.generalDetails:
1)Podiatry is a branch of medical science that deals with the lower half of the body. They are sometimes involved in diagnosing issues of the lower abdomen too. Popularly known as foot doctors, they specialize in issues of the ankles, the feet palm, and the toes and fingers of the feet.

2)Podiatrists provide medical and surgical care for people with foot, ankle, and lower leg problems. They diagnose illnesses and treat injuries.

3)Podiatrists can be involved in different branches of the field, such as specializations in wound care, pediatrics, sports medicine, diabetes, and surgery. They analyze the conditions of the feet and diagnose any ailments or disorders that may be present. 

4)They also provide treatment for the ailments through exercises, special footwear, and improving the patient’s mobility. They are responsible for performing foot surgeries if required, which can range from fracture repairs to correcting foot deformities.
